result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeramie D Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Received and filed.  aw

Defendant Jeramie D Lewis in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  PSI reviewed. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court ordered the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, and consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 56 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, treatment, real estate class if verified, and meeting with agent.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments.  Cash bail to apply.  Balance to be returned to poster. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, with credit for 56 DAYS time served; CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2, and consecutive to any other sentence.  The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  If defendant is revoked, same conditions apply to extended supervision as conditions of probation, except for the condition time.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 5 YEARS with the following conditions:  
COURT MAKES DEFENDANT ELIGIBLE FOR DOSAGE PROBATION.

- Serve 1 YEAR UP FRONT CONDITION TIME, in the House of Correction - with RELEASE for work, meeting with agent, real estate class if verified, and treatment.  

***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.***

- AODA assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers, and no drug paraphernalia.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Seek and maintain full time employment.  If defendant is in school, he may work part time.
- No contact with Antonio B., Broderick M., Trevon N., and Markell G., in person or thru a third party.  If defendant violates no contact order, he should be revoked.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, and assessments.  Cash bail to apply.  Balance of cash bail to be returned to poster.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

State request defendant to be remanded until sentencing.  Arguments heard.  Court is not remanding defendant at this time.  Defendant to bring in verification of employment at next court date.
